org.ehcache.core.spi.store.tiering

Interface AuthoritativeTier.Provider

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Service
    Enclosing interface:
    AuthoritativeTier<K,V>

    public static interface AuthoritativeTier.Provider
extends Service
    Service interface for providing AuthoritativeTier instances.

    Multiple providers may exist in a given CacheManager.

    • Method Detail

      • createAuthoritativeTier

        <K,V> AuthoritativeTier<K,V> createAuthoritativeTier(Store.Configuration<K,V> storeConfig,
                                                     ServiceConfiguration<?,?>... serviceConfigs)
        Creates a new AuthoritativeTier instance using the provided configuration.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the key type for this tier
        V - the value type for this tier
        Parameters:
        storeConfig - the Store configuration
        serviceConfigs - a collection of service configurations
        Returns:
        the new authoritative tier

      • releaseAuthoritativeTier

        void releaseAuthoritativeTier(AuthoritativeTier<?,?> resource)
        Releases an AuthoritativeTier.
        Parameters:
        resource - the authoritative tier to release
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if this provider does not know about this authoritative tier

      • initAuthoritativeTier

        void initAuthoritativeTier(AuthoritativeTier<?,?> resource)
        Initialises an AuthoritativeTier.
        Parameters:
        resource - the authoritative tier to initialise

      • rankAuthority

        int rankAuthority(ResourceType<?> authorityResource,
                  java.util.Collection<ServiceConfiguration<?,?>> serviceConfigs)
        Gets the internal ranking for the AuthoritativeTier instances provided by this Provider of the authority's ability to handle the specified resource.

        A higher rank value indicates a more capable AuthoritativeTier.

        Parameters:
        authorityResource - the ResourceType for the authority to handle
        serviceConfigs - the collection of ServiceConfiguration instances that may contribute to the ranking
        Returns:
        a non-negative rank indicating the ability of a AuthoritativeTier created by this Provider to handle the resource type specified by authorityResource; a rank of 0 indicates the authority can not handle the type specified in authorityResource
